target_text: and Lily are friends. They like to play on the farm. The farm has many animals. Tom and Lily like to feed the animals and pet them. One day, they see a new animal on the farm. It is a goat. The goat is colorful. It has white, black, brown, and yellow fur. The goat is very dirty. It has mud and grass on its fur. "Look, a colorful goat!" Tom says. "Let's wash the goat!" Lily says. They get a bucket of water and a brush. They go to the goat. The goat is friendly. It lets Tom and Lily wash it. They scrub the goat's fur with the brush. They splash the water on the goat. The goat shakes its head and makes a funny sound. "Ba-a-a-a!" the goat says. Tom and Lily laugh. They wash the goat until it is clean and shiny. The goat looks happy. It licks Tom and Lily's faces. "Thank you for washing me!" the goat says. "You're welcome, colorful goat!" Tom and Lily say. They hug the goat and play with it. They have fun on the farm.

upon a time, there was a brave knight. One day, he heard a terrified cry for help. He grabbed his weapon - a shiny sword - and rushed to the rescue. When he arrived, the knight saw a little bird that was frightened and flapping its wings in a panic. The knight carefully set it down on a nearby tree, and said: "Don't worry, little one. I'm here to help." The knight took out his weapon and used it to scare away the evil beast that had been chasing the bird. With the beast gone, the bird thanked the knight and flew away. The brave knight smiled and was relieved that he had been able to rescue the poor, frightened bird. He vowed to always use his weapon to help those in need.

upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play games with his friends. One day, Timmy's friend Johnny came over to play. Johnny brought a fake pirate sword to play with. Timmy said, "That's a cool sword, Johnny. Can we play pirates?" Johnny said, "Yes, let's play pirates and sail on a ship!" So, they pretended to sail on a ship and looked for treasure. Timmy found a treasure chest and said, "I found the treasure!" Johnny said, "That's great, Timmy. You won the game!"

upon a time, there was a zoo. In the zoo, there were many animals. One day, a new animal came to the zoo. It was a big, green parrot. The parrot could open its cage with its beak. All the animals saw this and they were jealous. The next day, the parrot opened its cage again. It flew around the zoo and said "hello" to all the animals. The animals wanted to be like the parrot. They wanted to open their cages too. But they didn't know how. Then, the parrot had an idea. It would help the other animals. The parrot went from one cage to another. It opened each cage with its beak. The animals were so happy. They were not jealous anymore. They thanked the parrot and played together in the zoo.

and Sam were brothers who liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big net on the grass. They wondered what it was for. "Maybe it is for catching birds," Tom said. "Or butterflies," Sam said. They ran to the net and picked it up. They wanted to try it out. "Let's catch that duck over there," Tom said, pointing to a pond. They sneaked up to the duck and threw the net over it. The duck quacked loudly and tried to get free. "Ha ha, we got it!" Tom and Sam cheered. But then they heard a voice behind them. "Hey, what are you doing?" It was the park ranger. He looked angry. He walked over to them and took the net off the duck. The duck swam away quickly. "This net is not for catching animals. It is for cleaning the pond. You could have hurt the duck or made it sick. That is not nice," he said. He explained to them that the net had special holes that let the water go through, but trapped the trash and weeds. He showed them how he used the net to make the pond cleaner and healthier for the animals and plants. Tom and Sam felt sorry for what they did. They did not know that the net had a good purpose. "We are sorry, sir. We did not mean to be mean. We just wanted to have fun," they said. The park ranger nodded. "I understand. But you should always be careful and re

upon a time, there was a little girl named Jinny. She was only three years old, but she was always very eager to learn new things and explore the world around her. One day Jinny was walking through the forest with her mommy, when she noticed something very special: a cozy little hut. Jinny wanted to go inside, but her mother told her not to – the hut looked a little bit too expensive, and she didn't want her daughter to get hurt. "Why can't I go inside?" asked Jinny. "Because it's not safe, sweetheart," her mother said as she gently urged Jinny to come away. Jinny was disappointed, but she listened to her mother and obediently followed her away from the hut. As they walked away, Jinny's mother told her a wise lesson: "Sometimes it's better to obey your parents, even if you don't understand why they're telling you to do something. They always have your best interests in mind." Jinny took this lesson to heart and from then on, she listened to her parents more carefully and learned to trust their judgment.

and Ben are playing with a big red ball in the park. They like to bounce the ball and catch it. Sometimes they bounce the ball to each other and say, "Catch!" One day, they see a bald man walking his dog near the post. The post is tall and has a sign on it. The sign says, "No ball games". The bald man looks angry and says, "Stop bouncing that ball! You are making too much noise and you might hit my dog!" Lily and Ben are scared and stop bouncing the ball. They say, "Sorry, sir. We didn't mean to bother you or your dog." They pick up the ball and walk away. The bald man says, "Good. Now go and play somewhere else. And don't come back here with that ball!" Lily and Ben are sad and look for another place to play. They find a big hill with a lot of grass and flowers. They say, "This looks like a nice place to play. Maybe we can bounce the ball here." They start to bounce the ball again and have fun. They forget about the bald man and his dog. They say, "We like to bounce the ball. It makes us happy. Bounce, bounce, bounce!"

upon a time there was a nosy bird. It wanted to look at all the things in the world. One day it decided to stay near a nest full of baby birds. The nosy bird watched the baby birds very carefully. It tried to listen to their conversations. It was very excited when they started to play. But soon the mother bird noticed the nosy bird. She told it to go away. The nosy bird didn't want to leave so it stayed where it was. The mother bird was a bit annoyed so she told the nosy bird a story. It was a story about the dangers of being nosy. After the story was finished the nosy bird flew away. It learned an important lesson that day. It was important to stay away from things that don't belong to you and to not be too nosy!

upon a time, there was a shy dove who lived in a big tree. One day, a little girl came to the tree and said, "Hello, dove! Can I be your friend?" The dove was scared and didn't say anything. The little girl said, "Don't be shy! I won't bite you." The dove felt better and said, "Okay, we can be friends." They played together and had fun. Suddenly, a big bird came and tried to bite the dove! The little girl said, "Don't worry, I'll protect you!" She scared the big bird away and the dove was very happy. They became best friends and played together every day. The end.

sun was shining, and it was a beautiful day. John was feeling excited as he and his mom were going shopping at the market. His mom held his hand tightly as she lead him through the aisles filled with food. John noticed the vegetables first. There were so many of them, and they looked so impressive. He also saw apples, oranges and bananas. Then, he spotted a cherry and his eyes lit up. He waved at his mom to get her attention, and he whispered, “Can I have one please?” His mom smiled and nodded. She handed him the cherry and said a few words about being careful and not eating too many. John smiled and thanked her for the treat. Sitting in the car on the way home, John kept thinking about the cherry. He still held it in his lap when he looked out the window and spotted a row of cherry trees. What a sight! There were so many cherries on the trees, and they looked even more impressive than the ones at the market. John's mom also noticed them, and smiled at John knowingly. It looked like the cherry from the market had lead John to the cherry tree.

and Max were very happy. It was the first day of summer. They wanted to play outside all day. They put on their hats and sunscreen. They ran to the park with their mom. At the park, they saw a big slide. They climbed up the ladder and slid down fast. They laughed and screamed. They saw a swing. They pushed each other high in the air. They felt the wind in their hair. They saw a sandbox. They dug and built castles and bridges. They made new friends. "Look, mom, look what we made!" Lily said. "That's very nice, sweetie," mom said. "You are very creative." "Can we go to the pond, mom?" Max asked. "We want to see the ducks and the fish." "Sure, honey, but be careful. Don't go too close to the water," mom said. They ran to the pond. They saw many ducks and fish. They threw some bread crumbs to them. They watched them eat and swim. They saw a frog. It was green and slimy. It jumped and croaked. They tried to catch it. "Ribbit, ribbit!" Max said. "Come here, froggy!" Lily said. The frog was too fast and wild. It hopped away. They chased it. They had fun. They did not see the sign. It said: "Beware of the goose." The goose was big and angry. It did not like the children. It saw them coming. It hissed and flapped its wings. It ran towards them. "Quack,

day, a little boy named Tom was walking down the street. All of a sudden, he saw a puppy who was hurt. Tom ran all the way home and quickly got his mom. He excitedly told her that he had seen a puppy, and asked if they could help it. His mom smiled and said, "Yes! We can raise the puppy and help it get better." Tom looked up and said, "Well, how do we raise it? It's so little!" His mom laughed and said, "Well, first we need to give it a warm place to sleep. We also need to give it food, and lots of love. That's the best way to raise a puppy!" Tom smiled with excitement. He and his mom worked together to find the best home for the puppy. They found the perfect place, and adopted the puppy. They spent the next few weeks teaching it how to bark and play. Now, Tom and his mom lovingly care for the puppy. They give him lots of love and make sure he's happy every day. Tom says that it was worth it to raise the little puppy!

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a fancy rug in her room that she loved to play on. One day, Lily's favorite toy went missing. She searched all over her room, but she couldn't find it. Lily asked her mom, "Mommy, have you seen my toy?" Her mom replied, "No, I haven't seen it. Maybe it's hiding under the rug." Lily lifted up the fancy rug and there it was, her toy! She was so happy to have found it. From that day on, Lily always checked under the rug when she couldn't find something.

day it was very gloomy outside. All of the children in the class were sad because they were stuck inside. Then, something special happened. One of the children saw a big rainbow outside. It looked so bright and dazzling. All of the children in the class ran to the window and stared in wonder. Then, something magical happened. Slowly, the rainbow started to melt into the sky. All of the children let out happy cries and clapped their hands in joy. The class was so happy and no longer gloomy. They admired the melted rainbow for the rest of the day.

upon a time there lived a deer in a forest. He was a friendly deer and he liked to say hello to all of the other animals. One day, he went to say hello to a rabbit when suddenly he noticed that there was something strange about him. "What is wrong?" asked the deer. The rabbit glanced at him nervously, "Someone has stolen my carrots! It was a serious crime!" "That's terrible!" said the deer. He felt very sad for the rabbit. The deer thought hard. He knew that he must help the rabbit. Finally he had an idea. That night, he went back to the same spot where the carrots had been stolen. He waited and waited until suddenly a fox appeared. The fox had a bag full of carrots! The deer was so angry he shouted,"Leave those carrots alone! Give them back to the rabbit!" The fox was so surprised. He dropped the carrots and ran away. The next day, the rabbit was very happy to have his carrots back. The deer was very proud of himself. He had saved the day!

ia loves robots. She loves playing with them and watching them move. Today she was playing with her robot under the tree and feeling happy. Suddenly, it stopped moving. Mia asked her robot to start again. But, it did not listen. Mia was sad and confused. She felt dizzy and didn't know what to do. Then, an older robot came over. It was bigger and more shiny than Mia's robot. Mia asked the older robot to help. The older robot asked Mia if she trusted it. Mia said yes and the older robot nodded and got to work. It fixed Mia's robot. Now, Mia's robot was working again. She was so happy. She thanked the older robot and hugged it tight. Mia learned that it was okay to trust others.

ack looked out of the window. He saw an elderly lady across the street. He wanted to go up and talk to her, because he thought she was so nice. He ran out of the house and went up to the lady, saying hello. The lady was very friendly, and she said hello back. She showed Jack something very special. It was a sparkly diamond. It was very beautiful, and Jack thought it was amazing. The lady told Jack that she had been keeping the diamond for a very long time. She said it was very special to her. Jack thought that was really nice. He thanked the elderly lady and went on his way. Jack went to tell his mum and dad about the diamond he had seen. He couldn't stop thinking about the special diamond.

upon a time, there was a little bunny named Peter. He loved to eat salad and play outside. One day, while he was eating his salad, a loud noise disturbed him. It was a bird chirping really loudly. Peter didn't like it because it was too noisy and it disturbed his lunch. Peter decided to play outside instead. He hopped around the garden and found a big carrot. It was the biggest carrot he had ever seen! Peter was so happy and proud of himself. He showed his carrot to his friends, but he was modest about it. He didn't want to brag or make anyone feel bad. Peter was a kind bunny who loved his friends and his salad.

day, a little boy named Timmy was playing in the park. He saw a bush and went to play near it. Suddenly, he heard a voice coming from the bush. "Please help me!" the voice said. Timmy was scared at first, but then he realized it was a little bird that got stuck in the bush. Timmy went closer to the bush and saw the bird. "Don't worry, little bird. I'll help you," he said. He carefully took the bird out of the bush and put it on the ground. The bird was very lively and started singing happily. "Thank you so much for helping me," the bird said. "You're welcome," Timmy replied. "I love birds and I don't want them to be stuck in a bush." The bird then flew away, and Timmy felt happy that he could help.

upon a time there was a little dragon. He was so small and miserable. He wanted to do something fun, but he was too little. One day he found an old sword. He picked it up and tried to lift it with all his might, but it was too heavy. He felt so sad that he couldn't lift it. But then he had an idea. Instead of using his arms, he decided to put it on a scale. He carefully put the sword on the scale and watched as it weighed it. To his surprise, it weighed very little! Now that it didn't weigh so much, the little dragon was able to lift it and carry it around with him. He was so happy that he had found a way to enjoy the sword. From then on, he used it to play and have fun all the time. He was no longer miserable, and he was so proud of his sword.

nna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. The park has a big gate. The gate is green and has flowers on it. One day, Anna and Ben go to the park. They see a dog. The dog is brown and has a long tail. The dog is friendly. He wags his tail and licks their hands. "Hello, dog!" Anna says. "What is your name?" The dog barks. He does not have a name tag. "Can we play with you?" Ben asks. The dog nods. He runs and jumps. Anna and Ben follow him. They play catch and fetch. They have fun. But then, they hear a whistle. It is the dog's owner. He is looking for the dog. "Come here, boy!" he calls. The dog hears him. He stops playing. He looks at Anna and Ben. He looks sad. "We have to go, dog," Anna says. "Your owner is here." The dog whines. He does not want to part with his new friends. "Bye, dog," Ben says. "We will miss you." They hug the dog. The dog licks their faces. He is grateful. The owner comes to the gate. He opens it. He thanks Anna and Ben for playing with his dog. "His name is Max," he says. "He is very friendly." "We know," Anna and Ben say. "We like Max." They wave goodbye to Max. Max waves his tail. He is happy. Anna and Ben walk home. They smile. They have made a new friend. They hope

upon a time, there was a charming little girl. She was packing up to go on an adventure. She took out her measure and placed it in the box she was packing. Carefully, the little girl measured out the items she wanted to take with her. Then she packed them all in her bag. The little girl was so excited! She had her measure, and now she was ready to go on her adventure. She said goodbye to her family and waved as she set off. The little girl had such a wonderful time. Everywhere she went she saw different and exciting things. She even met some charming new friends. Finally, it was time to go home. The girl was sad to leave, but she felt happy too. She had a bag full of memories and some special things she'd found, which she had carefully measured out with her measure. The little girl had had a fantastic adventure, and she couldn't wait to go on another.

day, Jack and his sister Jane were playing in the park. Jack had been running around and was feeling hot, so his sister got him some water to drink. The water tasted so good that Jack decided to fill up the empty bottle and take it home. As he poured the water into the bottle, it just wouldn't fit! He sighed in frustration. Jane then came over to help him. Together, they tried different things to make the bottle fit, but nothing worked. Suddenly, Jane had an idea. She took the lid off the bottle and it fit perfectly! Jack and Jane were both so happy they did a little dance. But then, they felt something weird. They heard a giggle coming from behind them. They both spun around and saw their dead grandmother smiling at them. Grandma said "Wow! I'm so proud of you two for finding a solution to the problem!" Jack and Jane smiled and ran to hug her, even though she was dead. They had missed her so much. Finally, the bottle fit just right, just like Jack and Jane's family.

upon a time, there was a big sister named Sally. She was very bossy. One day, she told her little brother Tim that he needed a haircut. Tim did not want a haircut, but Sally said she would do it for him. Sally took out scissors and started to cut Tim's hair. Tim sat very still. When Sally was done, she looked at Tim's hair. She wanted to examine it to make sure it was good. She looked and looked. Tim's haircut was a little funny, but Sally thought it was okay. Tim went to show his mom and dad his new haircut. They laughed and said it was very special. Tim was happy that he had a new haircut, even if it was a little funny. Sally felt proud that she could help her brother. From that day on, Sally was a little less bossy and always tried to help Tim in a nice way.

upon a time, there was a man named John. He had an intelligent wife named Jane. One day, John told Jane he wanted to set off on an adventure. Jane thought this was a great idea and they both packed their bags and set off. As they travelled, they explored new cities, ate tasty food and met amazing people. At the end of the adventure, John and Jane realised that they were a perfect match. They were very happy together! From then on, John and Jane continued to explore the world together. They were very intelligent and enjoyed learning about new cultures. They had the best adventures and stayed together forever.

there was a boy who loved to play football. He was only three years old but he was already a pro! One day he was playing football in the park, kicking it around and having a wild time. Suddenly, an old man appeared and said, "Hey little guy! Are you working on your football skills?" The boy smiled and nodded. The old man said, "That's great! Keep it up and one day you'll be a pro like me!" The boy was so excited! He wanted to work very hard to be a great player. He said to the old man, "Thanks for the advice! I'm gonna try my best!" The old man smiled and said, "You're a smart kid. Now go play!" So the boy kicked and chased the football until it was time to go home. Everyday the young boy worked and worked on his football skills until one day, he became a pro!

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her colorful pastels. She drew pictures of flowers, trees, and animals. She would show her drawings to her mommy and daddy, and they would always say how beautiful they were. One day, Lily left her pastels outside in the sun. They started to rot and become yucky. She was sad because she couldn't draw anymore. She asked her mommy and daddy to buy her new pastels, but they said no. Lily was so sad that she cried and cried. She missed her colorful pastels so much. She never left them outside in the sun again. The end.

upon a time, there was a big dragon. The dragon was dangerous. Everyone in the town was scared of the dragon. The dragon liked to slide down the big hill near the town. One day, a brave boy named Tim went to talk to the dragon. "Mr. Dragon, why are you dangerous?" asked Tim. The dragon looked at Tim and said, "I am not dangerous. I just want to play and slide down the hill. But people are scared of me." Tim thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! Let's show everyone that you are not dangerous. Let's slide down the hill together and have fun." So, Tim and the dragon went to the top of the hill. They slid down the hill together, laughing and having fun. The people in the town saw them and realized that the dragon was not dangerous. From that day on, everyone played with the dragon and had lots of fun sliding down the hill.

upon a time there was a dependable jellyfish named Jack. Every day Jack would swim in the sea and explore the world. One day Jack came across an old boat and asked if he could visit. But the old boat said, "I'm sorry Jack, I cannot permit you, it is too dangerous”. So Jack kept on swimming to find a better place. Suddenly, he found a nice rock and asked if he could use it as his home. But the rock said, "Yes Jack, you can. I will permit you to stay here". Jack was very happy and so he decided to make the rock his home. He slept in the rock and spent his days playing and exploring. He was very dependable and never left the rock. Jack became very popular among the other jellyfish in the sea, and they all wanted to visit him and play. The end.

sky was bright and the sun was warm. A little puppy was eager to explore outside for the first time. She nestled her nose into the grass and delighted in the smell of the earth. She gasped in surprise as she felt the grass tickling her belly. She then began to crawl through the grass, careful not to miss a single smell. Suddenly, she heard a friendly voice. "Hi there! What's your name?" The puppy looked up and saw a little girl standing there. She crawled up to the girl and nuzzled her hand happily. "My name is Spot," she said. The girl smiled. "That's a great name! I'm Jennie. Would you like to play with me?" She giggled. "Yes please!" Spot said eagerly. And so they ran around the garden, stopping now and then to smell the flowers. Spot was so pleased to have made a new friend. Jennie gave Spot a happy pat on the nose and said, "Let's play again soon!" Spot barked happily in agreement and watched as Jennie skipped away, waving goodbye. Spot turned back to the garden, eager for more adventures.

nna was a sweet girl who liked to play with her toys and her dog. But one day, she felt very sick and had a high fever. Her mom and dad were worried and took her to the doctor. The doctor was nice and gave her a check-up. He said she had a bad cold and needed to take some medicine and rest. Anna did not like the medicine. It was bitter and made her face scrunch up. She wanted to spit it out and run away. She thought the medicine was bad and the doctor was mean. She tried to escape from her mom and dad when they gave her the spoon. She hid under the bed and behind the couch. She cried and said no. But her mom and dad loved her and wanted her to get better. They explained to her that the medicine was good and the doctor was kind. They said the medicine would help her fight the germs and make her fever go away. They said the doctor cared for her and wanted her to be healthy. They said they would give her a hug and a kiss and a sweet treat after she took the medicine. Anna listened to her mom and dad and understood. She was brave and took the medicine. She made a funny face but swallowed it. She felt a warm hug and a kiss and a sweet treat. She smiled and said thank you. She felt a little better and cuddled with her dog. She learned that sometimes she had to do things she did not like for her own good. She learned to trust her mom and dad and the doctor. She learned to

day, a little boy named Tim wandered into the kitchen. He saw his mom putting dishes into the dishwasher. Tim was curious and wanted to help. "Mom, can I help?" he asked. His mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim, you can help me put the cups in." As they put the cups in the dishwasher, Tim noticed an icy cup. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Mom, why is this cup so cold?" he asked. His mom explained that the cup had been in the freezer to make it icy for a cold drink. After they finished with the dishwasher, Tim and his mom sat down to enjoy a cold drink from the icy cup. They laughed and talked, happy to have spent time together.
